title: Technobilder
author: Technobilder
content: Theres a lot of complaints for those 2 exchanges (others too I know but I focus on them first).Me too - I bought coins on HitBTC and YoBit - and now I have my investment stuck - either like HitBTC the withdrawel fee is 10% or more - or like with YoBit the coins are "under maintanance" and just not withdrawable.Users like me then can ask the support for help - but never get answers.As most coins - especially huge amount of very cheap coins are only tradable on YoBit and HitBTC if you look on coinmarketcap or cryptocompare - I guess its time to include those 2 mayor websites in our fight !I mean - look around - so many complaints about those 2 exchanges everywhere - but nothing changes !We need to complain to coinmarketcap and cryptocompare - and urge them to delist those 2 exchanges !That is the only way to HURT both exchanges - and get them out of business !Yes sure many people will LOOSE a lot of money - I too will LOOSE about 3500 Euro that way - but Im willing to because that way we can make sure that scammer exchanges in the future will not have it that easy like today.IF WE GET SCAMMERS DELISTED FROM THE MAYOR WEBSITES - AND NOT LISTED IN THE FUTURE - THE WHOLE CRYPTO UNIVERSE GETS SAFER !

comments.author: Mental89
comments.body: same here. i lost 900 usd on hitbtc and 5200 usd on yobit. i did arbitrage and got punched in my face.

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: i have never used Hitbtc but i say while there is the biggest scammer called bittrex still listed, that should be your priority. with Yobit at least you know where the problem comes from. they simply don't run wallets for 90% of the altcoins listed there. but if you withdraw the top 30-40 altcoins or bitcoin you will never have any issues and Yobit was never considered trusted to begin with.but bittrex used to be one of the trusted exchanges and one day they decided, ummm free money lets scam thousands of users who trusted us and become rich by robbing them. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=trust;u=96390

comments.author: seoincorporation
comments.body: To get those sites delisted from coinmarket cap will be really hard because both of the are verified companies. What we can do is to burn their repitation on trustpilot.But that will not make those sites stop scamming users, the Best thing to do is to stay away from them.

comments.author: Saint-loup
comments.body: I haven't seen much complaints about Yobit since long time ago to be honest and AFAIK they are not listed anymore on Coinmarketcap and large listing platforms. I know they offer some kind of HYIP investments or weird things but appart from that they don't lock accounts, never ask any KYC to anyone, and when a shitcoin is not available for deposit or withdraw anymore they always let the markets open to exchanges them. HitBTC is way more vicious and scammy IMO they are still letting deposits opened for Dogecoins but not withdrawals without any warnings, and the market they offer is 10times below the real price, for example.

comments.body: Quote from: Technobilder on January 08, 2018, 01:40:32 AMTheres a lot of complaints for those 2 exchanges (others too I know but I focus on them first).Me too - I bought coins on HitBTC and YoBit - and now I have my investment stuck - either like HitBTC the withdrawel fee is 10% or more - or like with YoBit the coins are "under maintanance" and just not withdrawable.The best they will do is to have something on Reputation, Trust scores of these exchanges, or Notes.These exchanges have long history and they won't be delisted on market cap websites when they are still operating and lively.  When these exchanges stop operations and die, they will be added to Exchange graveyards.
